article.title: MathML for Gecko-Based Browsers and Linux

abstract.para: The acquisition and installation of fonts sufficient to enable browsers based on the Gecko Display Engine to handle MathML is described. Mozilla and Firefox are Gecko-based.

The information in this document is targeted primarily toward the RFPK Software Team and associates and is specific to the computer systems and network installed in the RFPK Laboratory of the &dept; of the &uw;. RFPK is the Resource for Population Kinetics. Its work is supported, in part, by grant P41 EB-001975 of the National Institutes of Health (NIH) of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: As installed on linux systems, the Firefox and Mozilla browsers do a poor job of displaying MathML. The reason for this is that certain fonts are missing. RedHat and other distributors of linux do not include these fonts in their installation packages because the fonts are proprietary or otherwise restricted. Satisfactory fonts can, however, be downloaded separately from organizations that have the right to distribute them. This document describes a procedure for downloading and installing these fonts.

sect1.title: Download the Fonts and Copy to /tmp
sect1.para: Download the required fonts by clicking on these URLs:
Copy the three downloaded archives from wherever your browser put them (the default is your home directory) to the /tmp directory.

sect1.title: Install the Truetype Fonts
sect1.para: We will be installing two sets of TrueType fonts. One set was developed for TeX, and the other for Mathematica.

listitem.para:
Open a terminal window, then become root by executing this command:
su -

Make a directory for the fonts:
mkdir /usr/X11R6/lib/X11/fonts/MathML

Expand the downloaded font archives:
cd /tmp unzip texcm-ttf.zip unzip MathFonts_TrueType_42.exe

Copy the font files to the MathML directory:
cp Math*.ttf /usr/X11R6/lib/X11/fonts/MathML cp texcm-ttf/* /usr/X11R6/lib/X11/fonts/MathML

Inform X-Windows about the fonts:
cd /usr/X11R6/lib/X11/fonts/MathML ttmkfdir > fonts.scale mkfontdir chkfontpath -a /usr/X11R6/lib/X11/fonts/MathML

sect1.title: Make Fonts Available to Browser
sect1.para:
At this point the fonts are known to the X-Windows system. This should be good enough for Firefox and Mozilla. For some reason it is not. A simple work-around, however, is to copy the fonts to the ~.fonts subdirectory of your home directory:
exit # become an ordinary user cd ~ mkdir -p .fonts cp /usr/X11R6/lib/X11/fonts/MathML/*.ttf .fonts

listitem.para:
Open a terminal window, then become root by executing this command:
su -

Expand the downloaded archive:
cd /tmp tar xvzf symfontconfig.tar.gz cd symfontconfig ./install.sh
The script will ask you several questions. Answer y each time.

sect1.title: Restart X-Windows
sect1.para: Restart X-Windows by restarting your desktop. This is usually accomplished by logging out of the desktop, then logging back in.

sect1.title: Try It Out
sect1.para:
You can evaluate your browser's newly acquired facility with MathML by accessing the
W3C MathML TestSuite . When you first click this link, a pop-up window titled "Missing MathML Fonts" may appear. The pop-up contains a link to a page at Mozilla.org. If you follow the link, you will find a recommendation that linux users need to add exactly the same fonts that you have just installed. You can ignore this warning.
